place.name: LANGLEY
place.gazetteerText: LANGLEY, a village and a parish in Hollingbourn district, Kent. The village stands 4½ miles SE of Maidstone r. station, and has a post-office under Maidstone. The parish comprises 1,474 acres. Real property, £2,360. Pop., 386. Houses, 80. The property is much subdivided. The manor belongs to the Earl of Romney. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £390. * Patron, S. E. Pusey, Esq. The church was rebuilt in 1855; is in the pointed style; and has a tower and small spire. There is a school connected with the church. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: LANGLEY
place.gazetteerText: Langley, hamlet, in par. and 2 miles S. of Beckenham, Kent; in vicinity is the seat of Langley Park. (In 1887, John Bartholomew's Gazetteer of the British Isles)
